intro: Psephellus bornmuelleri, commonly known as the Cape snowflake, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves. The plant produces small, white, star-shaped flowers during the winter months, which give it its common name. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
